meanings.definition: To drop or let fall in a mass; to unload
meanings.sent1: She was dumping the toys into the box.
meanings.sent2: The workers were dumping the sand from the truck.
meanings.sent3: The kids were dumping the water on each other for fun.
meanings.sent4: The rain was dumping down on the roof all night.
meanings.sent5: He was dumping the ingredients into the mixing bowl with a loud clatter.

meanings.definition: To get rid of or discard as unwanted or burdensome
meanings.sent1: He was dumping his old clothes to make space in the closet.
meanings.sent2: She was dumping the broken toys in the trash.
meanings.sent3: The cat was dumping its toys all over the house.
meanings.sent4: After the breakup, she felt like dumping all his gifts.
meanings.sent5: They were dumping the useless papers into the shredder.

meanings.definition: A place where garbage is left; a landfill
meanings.sent1: The city built a new dumping for all the trash.
meanings.sent2: The dumping was overflowing with plastic bottles.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons were having a party at the dumping.
meanings.sent4: The dumping smelled terrible in the summer heat.
meanings.sent5: The birds were circling above the dumping looking for food.

meanings.definition: The act of selling goods in another country at a price lower than in the domestic market
meanings.sent1: The company was accused of dumping their products in foreign markets.
meanings.sent2: Dumping can harm local businesses in the importing country.
meanings.sent3: The idea of dumping goods at low prices seemed strange to him.
meanings.sent4: The practice of dumping goods can lead to trade disputes.
meanings.sent5: Dumping goods at low prices can create unfair competition in the market.
